chapter.title: Managing Admin Roles
chapter.para: An Admin Role defines the actions, also known as functional capabilities, that can be performed and the scope of control (the scope of control refers to the set of organizations managed by the admin role).

section.title: Features of Access Policies
section.para: This section describes the various features offered by an admin role in the following sections:

section.title: Capability
section.para: Capabilities represent administrative functions with Identity Manager. Capabilities are collections of fine-grained actions.

section.title: Scope of Control
section.para: Identity Manager allows you to control which users are within an admin's scope of control. Using Scope of Control, administrator can specify organizations that the members of the admin role can manage.

section.title: Publication
section.para: Identity Manager allows you to make the Admin Role available to organizations. Once the admin role has been published to these organizations, the organization administrators can grant them to other users.
